p:
The changes in Southern Chilean climate at the YD onset are broadly similar to other changes described at high southern latitudes. Evidence includes well-dated δ 18O and δD proxy climate records in Antarctic ice cores (Byrd Station
85 ; EPICA Dome C
86, 87 ; and TALDICE
88, 89 ), as well as Vostok
90 ; EPICA Dome ML
91, 92 ; and Taylor Dome
93 . This change is confirmed by a reconstruction of Antarctic atmospheric temperatures at EPICA Dome C
86, 87 . As at Pilauco, these records exhibit an abrupt cold-to-warm climate shift at ~12.8 ka, representing the end of the Antarctic Cold Reversal (Fig. 14).
